chav1961.purelib.basic.interfaces

Interface SyntaxTreeInterface<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndOrTree

    public interface SyntaxTreeInterface<T>

    This interface describes a quick syntax tree to store strings and associate any data to them.

    The main aim of interface is to radically reduce memory and time to manipulate with the string data. All methods of the interface are based on character arrays, not strings. This solution excludes any conversions between source data (usually char arrays) and their string representations. Every 'string' in the tree is identified by it's long id. Tree is optimized to use contiguous range of id's. Every string can also be associated with the object of any kind (called cargo).

    The main usages of this interface are a wide range of syntax trees.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    AndOrTree

    • Method Detail

      • placeName

        long placeName(char[] value,
               int from,
               int to,
               T cargo)

        Place new name into tree and assign unique id for it

        Parameters:
        value - name value
        from - from name index
        to - to name index
        cargo - cargo associated (can be null)
        Returns:
        id of the placed name. If exists, replaces cargo for the name

      • placeName

        long placeName(String name,
               T cargo)

        Place new name into tree and assign unique id for it

        Parameters:
        name - name to place into tree
        cargo - cargo associated (can be null)
        Returns:
        id of the placed name. If exists, replaces cargo for the name

      • placeName

        long placeName(char[] value,
               int from,
               int to,
               long id,
               T cargo)

        Place new name into tree with the given id

        Parameters:
        value - name value
        from - from name index
        to - to name index
        id - id associated with the name. If the name already exists, has no effect
        cargo - cargo associated (can be null)
        Returns:
        id of the placed name. If exists, replaces cargo for the name

      • seekName

        long seekName(char[] value,
              int from,
              int to)

        Seek name and return it's id

        Parameters:
        value - name value to seek
        from - from name index
        to - to name index
        Returns:
        id of the name or negative number if missing. Negative number value is -(position of the first different char + 1)

      • seekName

        long seekName(String name)

        Seek name and return it's id

        Parameters:
        name - name to seek
        Returns:
        id of the name or negative number if missing. Negative number value is -(position of the first different char + 1)

        boolean removeName(long id)

        Remove name from the tree

        Parameters:
        id - name id to remove
        Returns:
        true if successful

        void setCargo(long id,
              T cargo)

        Associate cargo with the given name

        Parameters:
        id - name id
        cargo - cargo to associate. Can be null. Replaces previous association

        Test existence of the name with the given id

        Returns:

      • getNameLength

        int getNameLength(long id)

        Get length of the name in chars

        Parameters:
        id - name id
        Returns:

      • getName

        String getName(long id)

        Get name by it's id

        Parameters:
        id - name id
        Returns:
        name or null if missing

      • getName

        int getName(long id,
            char[] target,
            int from)

        Get name by it's id

        Parameters:
        id - name id
        target - target to place result to. Target need to have enough space to store result. Use getNameLength to get space amount
        from - from index to fill
        Returns:
        end position in the target. If target less than need to store data, returned value will be negative

      • compareNames

        int compareNames(long first,
                 long second)

        Compare two names represented by it's identifiers

        Parameters:
        first - id of the first name
        second - id of the second name
        Returns:
        code is the same as for Comparable interface

      • walk

        void walk(SyntaxTreeInterface.Walker walker)

        Walk all the ids in the tree

        Parameters:
        walker - callback to process each walked item

      • size

        long size()

        Return amount of items in the tree

        Returns:
        amount of items

      • clear

        void clear()

        Clear tree content
